p: When following the fate of marked pistillate flowers, we found that 8.4% of flowers in C. scandens developed into mature fruits ( Table 2). In C. orbiculatus, 10.8% of flowers developed into mature fruits ( Table 2). When considering only fertilized flowers, the fruit set rates were 32.1% in C. scandens and 23.9% in C. orbiculatus. We did not find statistical support for a difference between species when considering all flowers (GLM with no fixed effect was preferred, ΔAICc = 1.0, Akaike weight = 0.627) or only fertilized flowers (ΔAICc = 0.41, Akaike weight = 0.551).
